title: Poland - Factors to Watch March 16
text: March 16, 2018 / 7:03 AM / Updated 43 minutes ago Poland - Factors to Watch March 16 Reuters Staff 2 Min Read Following are news stories, press reports and events to watch that may affect Poland’s financial markets on Friday. ALL TIMES GMT (Poland: GMT + 1 hour): WAGE AND EMPLOYMENT DATA The statistics office is due to publish corporate wage and employment data at 0900 GMT. C/A, NET INFLATION DATA The central bank is due to publish current account and net inflation data at 1300 GMT. ALLEGRO Allegro and Poland’s state-run postal group Poczta Polska plan to launch a network of parcel lockers across Poland, Gazeta Wyborcza daily said, quoting unidentified sources. COAL Poland’s coal output may fall this year to around 65 million tonnes from 66 million in 2017 as mining firms hold back on investment due to high services costs and labour shortages, Rzeczpospolita daily said, quoting industry sources. ****Reuters has not verified stories reported by Polish media and does not vouch for their accuracy.**** For other related news, double click on: Polish equities E.Europe equities Polish money Polish debt Eastern Europe All emerging markets Hot stocks Stock markets Market debt news Forex news For real-time index quotes, double click on: Warsaw WIG20 Budapest BUX Prague PX ($1 = 3.3831 zlotys) (Reporting by Warsaw Bureau)
